author: Esha Dasgupta
title: Thailand Issues Heavy Rains and Flash Flood Warnings
text:
The Thai Meteorological Department (TMD) has issued a nationwide weather warning for isolated heavy rainfall, effective from August 28, 2025. This forecast carries a risk of flash floods and river overflows, especially in low-lying areas and near foothills. The public is strongly advised to stay vigilant, avoid flood-prone zones, and exercise caution in waterways.
Discover the best time to visit Thailand, a season-wise guide to follow once the weather clears.

[August 26, 2025]
Several regions of Thailand are experiencing heavy to very heavy rainfall, particularly in parts of the upper North, Northeast, East, and along the southwestern coast. Isolated thundershowers are being caused by an active low-pressure system over the North and a moderate southwest monsoon prevailing over the Andaman Sea, Thailand, and the Gulf of Thailand.
High waves are expected to reach around 2 metres in the upper Andaman Sea and about 1 to 2 metres in the lower Andaman Sea and the upper Gulf of Thailand. Thai authorities have advised seafarers to navigate with caution and avoid sailing into thunderstorms.
TMD has issued warnings for heavy rains and thunderstorms for specific provinces in Thailand, including:
- Mae Hong Son,
Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai, Lamphun, Lampang, Phayao, Nan, and Tak in the north are expected to experience heavy rain and flooding. - Loei, Nong Khai, Bueng Kan, Nong Bua Lamphu, Udon Thani, Sakon Nakhon, Nakhon Phanom, Khon Kaen, Kalasin, Mukdahan, Maha Sarakham, Roi Et, Yasothon, Amnat Charoen, Sisaket, and Ubon Ratchathani in the northeast are expected to experience heavy rainfall.
- Kanchanaburi, Ratchaburi, Lopburi, and Saraburi in central Thailand are expected to experience thunderstorms.
- Ranong and
Phang Ngain the southern west coast are likely to experience thunderstorms as well as heavy rains. - Phetchaburi, Prachuap Khiri Khan, Chumphon, Surat Thani, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Phatthalung, Pattani, Yala, and Narathiwat on the southern east coast are expected to witness thunderstorms.
- Rayong, Chanthaburi, and Trat in the east are likely to experience thundershowers and heavy rains.
